release.description: This release of the Local Data Dictionary Tool is a component of the integrated release 2.1.0 of the PDS4 System. This is an operational release of the system components to date.

Added property maps listing to schema as documentation – Option “n”
Write Information Model Specification - Option “1”
Made out file names consistent. All namespace ids have been uppercased.

release.description: This release of the Local Data Dictionary Tool is a component of the integrated release 2.0.0 of the PDS4 System.
release.action: Added Element_Flag to indicate classes to be defined as xs:element
Fixed problem with “choice” group of classes.
General code cleanup to align LDDTool with master PDS4 standard document generation code.
Fixed problem with descriptions that have tokens wider than the printed text block, for example URLs.
Fixed problem with processing cycles in Ingest_LDD, for example, a class definition that references itself as a parent.

release.description: This release of the Local Data Dictionary Tool is a component of the integrated release 0.1.0 of the PDS4 System.
release.action: Fixed bug in referencing common attributes. a. E.g. the attribute "comment" in display class. (Note that the next version of the common schema still needs to create elements for each attribute defined as a simpleType or defined using PDS4 data_types.)

Fixed bug in extension/restriction associations. Added “parent_of” as permissible value for "reference type" to ultimately replace “subclass_of”, “extension_of”, and “restriction_of”. The original reference_types indicated the wrong direction. (Note that the next version of the common schema needs to be updated to no longer allow the original reference_types.)

release.description: This release of the Local Data Dictionary Tool is a component of the integrated release 0.1.0 of the PDS4 System.
release.action: Allow mixed LDD and External components in xs:choice.
Added –v option to report version
Allow LDD templates to define classes and attributes that already exist but report a warning.
Write XML label for LDD schema file
Reference the USER (owned) attributes in the master DB for an external reference.
Changed Build 3b to Build 4a in schema and schematron file comments.
Added support for xs:any

release.description: This release of the Local Data Dictionary Tool is a component of the integrated release 0.1.0 of the PDS4 System.
release.action: Added additional validation checks and output messages a. Validate that each attribute is referenced in an association and report a warning if this is not the case. b. Validate that all names, either class or attribute, are unique in the specified namespace and report an error if this is not the case.
Write error messages to both the output (log) file and the report file.

Write an additional .cvs file for each language specified in any terminological entry. The file name includes the language name. Any name or definition in a language other than English is substituted in.
Now use the LDD namespace id for the following namespace declaration in the schematron file.
Fixed class order.

release.description: This release of the Local Data Dictionary Tool is a component of the integrated release 0.1.0 of the PDS4 System.
release.action: Added command line options to write element definitions in the XML Schema file. a. -c - Write definitions for class elements b. -a - Write definitions for attribute elements
Update for RFA_Build3b_076: removed “SAMPLE” from title.

release.description: This release of the Local Data Dictionary Tool is a component of the integrated release 0.1.0 of the PDS4 System.
release.action: Updated master schema to Release 1.0.0.0.

Integrated LDD Tool processing code into master schema processing code. a. The LDD XML Schema and Schematron files are now created by the code that creates the master schema. This update improves consistency.
The definition of subclasses is now allowed.
The schematron rules for enumerated lists are now properly written to the schematron file.
The schematron rules for enumerated lists are now properly written to the schematron file.
The “version” segment of a directory path is now the major number (first digit) of the Information Model Version Id.
The first lines of the schema and schematron file headers have been updated to indicate that the files are for operational use.
